document.masterDocTitle: Family placement of the enigmatic Otagia neozelanica (Chilton, 1897) Haustorioidea: Otagiidae fam. nov. (Amphipoda: Crustacea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Family placement of the enigmatic Otagia neozelanica (Chilton, 1897) Haustorioidea: Otagiidae fam. nov. (Amphipoda: Crustacea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
. Neotype , female, 3.8 mm , dissected, 3 slides, SEM pin mount, NIWA 85992 , South Taranaki Bight, south of Hawera, New Zealand (- 39.78 , 174.29 ), soft sediment, 27 m ,
1 / 11 / 2011
, coll. NIWA (IKA 1101 / 141 ).

Type locality
. South Taranaki Bight, south of Hawera, New Zealand (- 39.78 , 174.298 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2. Scanning Electron Images of
Otagia neozelanica (Chilton 1879)
female 3.8 mm, NIWA 85992 (except B) female 3.76 mm NIWA 86538, A) lateral of the habitus (200 µm); B) epimera 1–3 (200 µm); C) dorsal view of the habitus (200 µm); D) pereopod 4 plumose setae (100 µm); E) lateral-and F) dorsal view of head (100 µm); G) rostrum with arrows indicating micro sensory pits around the apical constriction.

FIGURE 3.
Otagia neozelanica (Chilton 1879)
habitus female 3.76 mm, NIWA 86538. Parts neotype female 3.8 mm, NIWA 85992, collected in the South Taranaki Bight, New Zealand. Scales 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description . Based on neotype female 3.8 mm , NIWA 85992 . Head longer than deep; rostrum cone-shaped with anteroventral keel and apical constriction; apical constriction with micro sensory pits; lateral cephalic lobe absent; anteroventral margin oblique; anteroventral corner absent; eye cluster round to ovoid, not ommatidial.
Antenna 1
shorter than peduncle of antenna 2 ; peduncle with many plumose setae; peduncular article 1 shorter than article 2 ; article 2 longer than article 3 ; article 3 shorter than article 1 ; primary flagellum short, length less than peduncle, with 6 articles; accessory flagellum long, 4 -articulate; callynophore and calceoli absent.
Antenna 2
a fifth of body length; peduncle lined with plumose setae, article 4 length 2.5 times breadth, subequal to article 5 ; flagellum shorter than peduncle, 6 -articulate. Upper lip entire. Mandible incisor with long smooth cutting edge; lacinia mobilis asymmetrical, broader than long with serrate margin; accessory setal row absent; molar columnar, large, covering two fifths of mandible surface, strongly triturating; mandibular palp article 1 short, as broad as long; article 2 long, medially flexed, 6 times as long as broad, 1.8 times article 3 , with 3 short medial setae; article 3 longer than article 1 , 3.4 times as long as broad, with apical cluster of long setae.
Maxilla 1
inner plate with two apical plumose setae; outer plate with 9 apical setal teeth; palp 2 -articulate, broad with many slender apical setae.
Maxilla 2
inner plate subequal to outer plate, slightly longer than broad. Lower lip inner lobes present; mandibular lobes well-developed. Maxilliped basal endite with 3 short apical robust setae; ischial endite (obscured in slide mount), 3 + apical robust setae; palp article 2 medial surface with dense brush of slender setae; dactylus welldeveloped.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Otagia neozelanica (Chilton 1879)
neotype female 3.8 mm, NIWA 85992, collected in the South Taranaki Bight, New Zealand. Scales 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 5.
Otagia neozelanica
(Chilton 1879)
neotype female 3.8 mm, NIWA 85992, collected in the South Taranaki Bight, New Zealand. Scales 0.1 mm. Insert A) Scanning Electron Image of pereopod 3, arrow indicates vestigial dactylus (100 µm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Coxae 1–4
progressively larger, longer than broad, overlapping.
Gnathopod 1
dissimilar in form to gnathopod 2 ; simple; coxa subrectangular, 1.5 times as long as broad, smaller than coxa 2 , not produced anteroventrally; basis elongate, 5 times as long as broad, anterodistal margin with short slender setae, posterodistal margin with very long slender setae; ischium and merus compressed, as broad as long; carpus 3.5 times as long as broad, longer than propodus, posterior margin with thick fringe of slender setae; propodus twice as long as broad, posterior margin with mainly distal slender setae; dactylus short, 3 times as long as broad, half the length of propodus.
Gnathopod 2
minutely chelate; coxa subquadrate, twice as broad as long; basis elongate, 6 times as long as broad, posterodistal margin with long slender setae; ischium and merus compressed, as broad as long, posterior margin with a few long slender setae; carpus 2.8 times as long as broad, twice as long as propodus, posterior margin lined with fringe of slender setae; propodus subovate, twice as long as broad, posterior margin with mainly distal slender setae, posterodistal chelation acute; dactylus minute, with 3 apical teeth.
Pereopods 3−4
dissimilar.
Pereopod 3
coxa 1.4 times as long as broad; basis rectolinear, 4 times as long as broad; ischium compressed, slightly broader than long; merus rectolinear, 3 times as long as broad, much longer than propodus, anterior margin lined with 3 long plumose setae, posterior margin lined with 4 long plumose setae; carpus as broad as long, shorter than propodus, posterior margin with proximal long slender setae and distal long robust setae; propodus twice as long as broad, posterodistal corner with many long robust setae; dactylus vestigial, obscured by propodus robust setae.
Pereopod 4
coxa as broad as long, larger than coxa 3 , with well-developed posteroventral lobe, lobe posterior margin subquadrate; basis rectolinear 4.5 times as long as broad, anterodistal corner with single seta; ischium compressed, broader than long; merus 3 times as long as broad, much longer than propodus, anterior margin lined with 3 long plumose setae, posterior margin lined with 4 long plumose setae; carpus as long as broad, subequal to propodus, posterior margin lined with extremely long plumose setae; propodus 2.5 times as long as broad, posterodistal corner with cluster of long apical robust setae; dactylus vestigial.
Pereopods 5–7
heterogeneous, pereopod 7 much shorter than and dissimilar to pereopods 5−6 .
Pereopod 5
coxa bilobate with broader posterior lobe, posterior lobe margin with 3 long robust setae; basis expanded, subovate, anterior margin with a few rows of long robust setae; ischium compressed, broader than long; merus expanded, posterior margin lined with plumose and robust setae; carpus expanded, twice as long as broad, longer than propodus, margins lined with long robust setae; propodus 3 times as long as broad, margins lined with long slender and robust setae; dactylus simple, tapering distally, 0.7 as long as propodus.
Pereopod 6
subequal in length to pereopod 5 ; coxa bilobate with broader posterior lobe, posterior lobe margin with 2 long robust setae; basis expanded, subovate, anterior margin with long robust setae, facial surface with single medial plumose seta; ischium compressed, broader than long; merus expanded, posterior margin with plumose and robust setae, posterodistal corner with 2 plumose setae; carpus 3 times as long as broad, longer than propodus, margins with long robust setae; propodus 3 times as long as broad, margins with long slender and robust setae; dactylus simple, tapering distally, 0.7 times as long as propodus.
Pereopod 7
two thirds the length of pereopod 5 ; basis strongly expanded, breadth 1.5 times length, subovate, posterior margin convex, posterior ventral lobe broadly rounded, inner surface with single medial plumose seta; ischium compressed, broader than long; merus expanded, posterior margin lined with long plumose setae; carpus broader than long, subequal in length to propodus, facial surface lined with rows of robust setae; propodus length subequal to carpus, twice as long as broad, with facial rows of robust setae; dactylus simple, tapering distally, medium length, 0.7 times length of propodus.

Pleon not compressed or dorsoventrally flattened.
Pleonite 3
greatly extended, length subequal to pleonites 1−2 combined.
Epimeron 1
subquadrate, anterior margin convex, corner with notch and small acute tooth.
Epimeron 2
subquadrate, anterior margin convex, corner with notch and small acute tooth, ventral margin lined with plumose setae.
Epimeron 3
subquadrate, anterior margin straight, scalloped, with slender setae, corner rounded, ventral margin with plumose setae.
Pleopods 1–3
without coupling hooks.
Pleopods 1–2
similar, peduncle twice as long as broad; basal article of outer ramus twice as long as broad, posterior margin with long slender setae, rami subequal in length.
Pleopod 3
reduced, smaller than pleopod 1 , peduncle twice as long as broad; inner ramus slightly shorter than outer ramus.

Uropod 1
biramous; peduncle 4 times as long as broad, 0.8 times length of outer ramus, with basofacial robust seta, dorsodistal corners each with large robust seta; outer ramus subequal in length to inner ramus, with marginal and apical long robust setae.
Uropod 2
biramous, peduncle 3 times as long as broad, 1.2 times length of outer ramus, dorsodistal medial corner with broad robust setae, dorsal margins lined with long and short robust setae; inner ramus longer than outer ramus, with marginal and apical long robust setae.
Uropod 3
biramous; peduncle twice as long as broad, 0.6 times length of outer ramus; rami foliaceous; outer ramus 2 -articulate, 3 times as long as broad, article 2 long; inner ramus shorter than outer ramus, apices with cluster of long plumose setae.
Telson
laminar; longer than broad; cleft to 66 % of length, lobes divergent; 2 pairs of lateral small plumose seta, lobe apices each with pair of robust setae ( 1 large and 1 medium length).
Distribution . New Zealand : Otago and South Taranaki Bight.
